Learning - Senior Specialist

Company Name Telstra Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 19 hours ago Number of views 36 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Senior Learning Specialist

Telstra is Australia’s leading telecommunications and information Services Company, offering a full range of communication services and competing in all telecommunications markets. As one of Australia’s most iconic brands, we value and respect our staff, offering a collaborative, supportive and flexible working environment, where you are empowered to develop your career.

An exciting opportunity exists for an experienced Technical Senior Learning Specialist to join the HR Strategy and Products team. Reporting to Head of Learning, the Technical Senior Learning Specialist is predominantly responsible for developing and driving the technical learning strategic plan in a changing world of technology, to uplift capabilities that will drive our success.

Key Accountabilities
  • Lead the Learning and Development Planning processes – bottom up/top down:
    • Acquire a deep knowledge of the relevant business strategy and aligned capability needs across our technical workforce
    • Work with the relevant organisational leadership to develop and implement the technical learning strategy and perform the high level scoping of all capability requirements (including understanding what the business is solving for, the time period required to address the capability gap and the audience)
    • Create and drive the annual and quarterly BU capability planning process to produce an accurate and pragmatic plan
  • Execute on key parts of the Learning and Development Plan:
    • Work with relevant HR stakeholders and BU leadership to drive a Learning culture into the organisation – with transparency about the Learning opportunities available to them to deepen and broaden their capability and career
    • Work with relevant HR and BU stakeholders to identify the need for BU Learning content creation or curation – and then work into the rest of the Learning team to execute on this
    • Identify and support the priority programs within the BU – ensuring the right approach, supported by effective Learning technology and insights
    • Work with the with relevant organisational leadership teams on ‘cross BU’ capability priorities, e.g. Project Management capabilities, to ensure that Enterprise capability solutions are appropriate for the BU
  • Broader team involvement and leadership:
  • Project manage the development and implementation of appropriate initiatives and programs to achieve the business people strategies
  • Contribute to the development of the business plan, goals and measures at Enterprise level
  • Identify and optimise innovation opportunities within the function/discipline


Experience Required
  • Deep technical specialty and technical learning experience across the areas of Learning architecture; Scoping and Design management and Content Curation.
  • Experience influencing senior stakeholders (internal and external) - demonstrated experience in managing senior business unit level relationships; ability to influence to achieve a positive outcome for Telstra
  • Successfully working in a corporate, matrix organisation
  • Demonstrated success delivering against key performance indicators and delivering results within agreed timeframes
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Experience in managing large programs and, ideally, learning interventions

We’re committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce. To enable everyone to participate, we’ve developed an ‘All Roles Flex’ policy to consider flexible ways of working for every role. To learn more, visit

Industry

  • Information Technology and Services
  • Online Media
  • Telecommunications

Employment Type

Full-time

Tableau Strategy and Reporting Analyst - 6 month Fixed term contract

Company Name Optus Company Location Melbourne, AU

Job description

So, Why Optus?

We see ourselves leading Australia in outstanding customer experience. In striving to achieve this, five core values guide us. These are: customer service, our challenger spirit, teamwork, integrity and personal excellence.

We’ve put a lot of investment behind innovation and would love to work with people who provide ideas that differentiate, disrupt and deliver amazing services for our customers.

Reporting to the Collections Insights and Analytics Manager the Portfolio Analyst will proactively work with our key stakeholders to provide analytics in order to generate product and commercial insights to enable improvements to financial performance as well as our customer’s experience. Additionally, you will be assisting with the annual planning, operational performance reporting and development of budget models including the creation and maintenance of forecasts.

Key Responsibilities Include
  • Develop and present data analysis and insights on portfolio performance to help deliver on business objectives and outcomes
  • reporting and performance monitoring processes to enable the management team to monitor business performance and drive accountability
  • Identify, quantify & highlight opportunities for continuous improvement in all aspects of the Credit Risk Management cycle including resolving internal control gaps and implementing effective controls.
  • Enhance forecast modelling to improve the accuracy & transparency of drivers for key Credit initiatives and performance indicators
  • Provide insight on actual performance compared with forecast including recommendations to achieve targets.


To Be Considered You Must Possess
  • A relevant degree in Business/Statistics/IT.
  • Strong understanding of relational databases and ability to query and perform complex data joins via Teradata SQL a must.
  • Minimum 2 years experience in a credit/collections environment.
  • Programming / automation /data mining
  • Extensive knowledge in high volume acquisitions
  • Demonstrated technical skills in statistical analysis tools and concepts (Excel, SQL, Visio, Powerpoint, Tableau)
  • Technically minded – able to understand complex technical issues
  • Expert analytical and problem solving skills


Employee Benefits (Only Applicable For Full Time Employees)

Working at Optus will provide you with a range of benefits that will enrich your personal and professional life. With features such as a range on on-site Health and Wellbeing specialists, financial advisers, company discounts and child care services, we ensure that we provide you with a safe and productive work environment.

Please navigate to http://www.optus.com.au/about/careers to find out more about life at Optus.

Optus believes in the strength of a vibrant, diverse and inclusive workforce where backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our people help us innovate and create strong connections with our customers.

Cabrini General Practice Manager

Company Name Cabrini HEALTH Company Location Elsternwick, AU

Posted Date Posted 4 days ago Number of views 120 views

Job description

Cabrini

Cabrini is a Catholic charitable organisation inspired by the spirit and vision of Saint Frances Xavier Cabrini and the Missionary Sisters of the Sacred Heart of Jesus. This order was founded by Saint Frances Xavier Cabrini who was canonised in 1946 and later proclaimed Universal Patron Saint of Immigrants. We are a community of care, reaching out with compassion, integrity, courage and respect to all we serve. With more than 4300 staff, 1000 accredited medical practitioners and several locations, we offer a range of employment opportunities to start, continue or advance your career.

The Role

Applications are sought for an experienced General Practice Manager for the Cabrini Health GP Practice located in Glenhuntly Road, Caulfield South. The Practice has a large and loyal patient register. Our GP’s are supported by Practice Nurses, an experienced Reception Team and the wider Cabrini Health team and infrastructure.

The Practice Manager is responsible for the daily operational, business activities and performance of the Cabrini GP Practice. This includes governance, compliance and leadership and the management and administration of employees in accordance with the Cabrini Mission, Values and Behaviours that Matter.

Key Selection Criteria
  • Experience as a Practice Manager in a private General Practice setting
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Demonstrated understanding of financial management
  • Sound knowledge of Medical and GP Practice billing systems
  • Ability to manage and lead human resources
  • Practice Accreditation experience and ability to implement quality systems
  • Understanding of relevant legislation including but not limited to the Privacy Act, OH&S and Industrial laws.


Experience
  • Demonstrated understanding of financial management of GP Practice
  • Qualifications in small business (not essential)
  • Advanced communication skills written and verbal
  • High level of computer literacy and knowledge of General practice clinical and management software
  • Operating and overseeing the efficient functionality of PracSoft/Medical Director / EFTPOS/TYRO/HICAPS and requisite reporting to the Department
  • HPOS ( Health Professional Online Services)

Cabrini Offers
  • Salary Packaging
  • Professional development opportunities
  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
  • Close to public transportation

Cabrini is an equal opportunity employer

Cabrini is committed to providing a safe environment for children

Compassion – Integrity – Courage - Respect

Executive

  • Health, Wellness and Fitness
  • Medical Practice
  • Hospital & Health Care

Accounting / Taxation / Business Services

- A long-term opportunity in a well established accounting firm.

- Generous remuneration.

- Regular Training with Tax Banter Pty Ltd & monthly tax discussion groups

- Conveniently located in Moonee Ponds close to public transport.

- A result-orientated accountant who will be responsible for all aspects of taxation & accounting requirements of the client.

Assessment Officer

Company Name City of Stonnington Company Location Malvern, AU

Posted Date Posted 4 days ago Number of views 76 views

Be an early applicant

Job description


Assessment Officer

Applications close 16/09/2018

  • Salary: $81,111 to $87,843 per annum + Monthly ADO + Superannuation
  • Temporary Full Time, Temporary Part Time
  • Fantastic benefits, staff wellbeing programs, monthly ADO & more!

The City of Stonnington has an exciting opportunity for an experienced Assessment Officer to join our Aged Services Team until 30th June 2019.

We are seeking candidates for an immediate start and advertising will close once a suitable applicant has been found. To ensure the best chance of being considered, please apply with your Resume, Cover Letter and response to the Key Selection Criteria (located at the bottom of the Position Description) as soon as possible. This position is full time for 5 days a week, however, flexible work days may be considered.

You will be responsible for completing Living at Home assessments and ongoing Support Plan reviews of residents within the aged and disability group target in the community. As an Assessment Officer, you will also be responsible for the approval and referral of services under the Commonwealth Home Care Programme, Home and Community Care Programme for Younger People and other community and Council Services.

You will have a tertiary qualification in Health, Allied Health or Social Science and substantial experience in assessments in Local Government or the Community sector. Additionally, you will have detailed knowledge and understanding of the principles of Aged and Disability Services for the community and substantial experience in providing good customer service to a wide range of people from diverse backgrounds and life experiences. Experience in conducting Living at Home assessments in the community and use of the My Aged Care Portal are essential.

At the City of Stonnington, ambition and expertise will be recognised and rewarded, in an environment that fosters personal career development as part of a unique team culture.

We are currently undergoing Enterprise Agreement negotiations which, if agreed, this position will have a new salary range of $84,802.07 - $91,841.34 per annum + a monthly ADO + Superannuation.

As an employee, you will have access to some fantastic benefits and be able to participate in staff wellbeing programs, previously nominated as a finalist in both the VicHealth and Worksafe Awards. For full time arrangements, employees will also accrue a monthly day off. Additionally, you will receive annual leave loading, ongoing training opportunities and work for an organisation with a dedicated Green Team.

Work for Stonnington today. Work that matters. People who make a difference.

Submitting your application

A Position Description is attached below for your perusal which includes the Key Selection Criteria. Applicants must address the Key Selection Criteria as part of their application. To be eligible to apply for this position you must have an appropriate Australian or New Zealand work visa.

For further information on how to apply contact the Council’s Recruitment Officer on Ph: 03 8290 1333.
For position related queries, please contact Angela Clarebrough on Ph: 8290 3596

Entry level

  • Government Administration
  • Health, Wellness and Fitness

About The Business

My client is a global, ASX-listed organisation operating within heavy industry. Known for their excellent working culture, flexible work environment and professional development programs, they are an employer of choice in the Melbourne market. Their offices are based in a the Melbourne CBD.

About The Role

This is a 10-month maternity cover position working within Group Finance. Reporting into the Group Finance Manager, your specific responsibilities will include:
  • Maintaining Fixed Asset Register (FAR) integrity including processing disposals, acquisitions and transfers
  • Management of Capital Approval Process
  • Management of open projects in SAP, including transfer from WIP to FAR
  • Reconciliation of CAPEX Budget to actual spend in SAP with project managers
  • Monthly Financial and Management reporting
  • Prepare monthly Fixed Asset balance sheet account reconciliations
  • Drive business compliance with Fixed Asset Policies & Procedures
  • Ongoing process improvement of Fixed Asset reporting


About You
  • CPA/CA qualified (or working towards)
  • 2-3 years experience working within a Fixed Assets Accounting capacity
  • Experience using SAP, along with strong Excel skills
  • Strong communication skills and ability to translate analysis into action orientated insights.
  • Self-directed with the ability to work autonomously
